snippet: A new document underscores the Obama administration’s chilling analysis of executive power.
abstract: Editorial contends newly disclosed document offering legal reasoning behind Pres Obama's claim that he has power to order killing of American citizens believed to be part of Al Qaeda underscores administration's chilling analysis of executive power; asserts memo should have been released much earlier, and that going forward, Obama should submit decisions like one to kill Anwar al-Awlaki and his son to review by Congress and courts.
lead_paragraph: A new document underscores the Obama administration’s chilling analysis of executive power.
